intro: Myriadenus, commonly known as the many-toothed plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its dense, often hairy foliage and composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The leaves are typically narrow and serrated, with a variety of tooth-like structures along the margins. The plant is native to various regions in Africa, South America, and parts of Asia. It is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
